thread.title: Watch: Anderson Silva stuns Derek Brunson at UFC 208
thread.title_full: Watch: Anderson Silva stuns Derek Brunson at UFC 208

title: Watch: Anderson Silva stuns Derek Brunson at UFC 208
text:
Manage Watch: Anderson Silva stuns Derek Brunson at UFC 208 Former UFC middleweight champion Anderson "The Spider" Silva stunned the mixed martial arts world on Saturday night, defeating Derek Brunson in a unanimous decision in Slot to 247Sports Links (Photo: Screen shot of Twitter video) 
Former UFC middleweight champion Anderson "The Spider" Silva stunned the mixed martial arts world on Saturday night, defeating Derek Brunson in a unanimous decision in the co-main event of UFC 208 at Barclays Center in New York. 
The fan favorite won on all three judges cards, taking home a 29-28, 29-28, 30-27 victory. Silva went toe-to-toe with the younger foe and took some punishment but dished out enough of his own to earn the win. â€” #UFC208 (@ufc) February 12, 2017 
Silva, 41, won for the first time in more than four years. Silva was apparently just aggressive enough in the judges eyes to offset what appeared to be a slight advantage in significant blows for Brunson. 
In round two Silva did land a nice spinning back fist, but Brunson responded with a takedown and got in some more solid shots. 
Brunson was a prohibitive favorite entering the fight. He improved to 16-5 while Silva improved to 34-8-1 in his storied career. 
Social media reaction was mixed after the bout, with many of the belief that Brunson was the winner of the fight. In fact, Brandon Wise of CBS Sports said in the site's live blog, " That is an all time shocker to me." 
Here is what Silva said after the fight.
